CARDINAL . The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

CARDINAL . On DATE , a holiday in GPE , the CARDINAL men referred to above and the applicant PERSON , all from GPE of Razgeh , went on horseback into the mountains near their village ( towards the NORP valley ) to collect wild vegetables and fruit , such as mushrooms and rhubarb .

CARDINAL . When they reached the top of NORP , which was QUANTITY from the NORP border , they heard the sound of helicopters . CARDINAL fighter helicopters circled overhead a few times and opened fire on the men . PERSON horse was killed by a rocket fired from the helicopters . The helicopters landed and the villagers were surrounded by CARDINAL NORP soldiers . CARDINAL . Subsequent to the impugned events , ORG made several attempts to offer compensation to the applicants through the NORP authorities . The authorities of ORG placed the applicants under considerable pressure to accept the compensation , including threats of violence and daily visits from the NORP authorities . ORG also imprisoned the eighth applicant on CARDINAL separate occasions , in an attempt to silence him and prevent him from telling the truth about the incident . Mr PERSON PERSON , the brother of the deceased victims PERSON and PERSON , was harassed by ORG for taking steps to pursue the investigation into their deaths and was forced to flee the country and take refuge in GPE .

CARDINAL . Prior to the alleged events in question , the authorities were informed that a terrorist group would be entering GPE with arms and equipment . Accordingly , the authorities planned a series of operations in order to prevent the entry of this terrorist group into NORP territory .
CARDINAL . On DATE operations started in the area between ORG and the NORP - Turkish border .

CARDINAL . On DATE , at TIME , the security forces received information to the effect that an armed group , accompanied by animals and mules loaded with arms and equipment , had entered GPE at a location QUANTITY away from border stone no . CARDINAL in the GPE area .

CARDINAL . Given that the location in question was usually used by terrorists making their entry into GPE in violation of border regulations , the security forces , which were carrying out a search operation in LOC at the relevant time , arrived at the scene by helicopter . Thereupon , the members of the suspicious group began to run away in various directions and did not stop despite warning shots from the helicopters . Considering that the land could have been mined and that the terrain was rough , the helicopters did not land but opened fire in order to prevent suspects from fleeing .

CARDINAL . DATE , after taking the necessary security measures , the security forces carried out a search at the scene of the incident . Although no corpses were found at the scene of the incident , the security forces noticed that there were traces of blood leading in the direction of the NORP border . Therefore , they concluded that some of the terrorists had either been wounded or their corpses had been carried away by others .

CARDINAL . On DATE the NORP Ambassador to GPE was summoned to ORG to provide information on the killing of CARDINAL NORP men on DATE while they were engaged in cross - border trade . From this the NORP authorities understood that the QUANTITY persons of NORP origin had been killed during the operation in question . However , there was no allegation by the NORP authorities that the NORP security forces had violated NORP borders . Contrary to the applicants ' allegations , no cross - border operation had taken place and the security forces had not arrested or detained anybody in the course of the events .

CARDINAL . The Criminal Code in force at the material time made it a criminal offence
( a ) to deprive an individual unlawfully of his or her liberty ( LAW generally , LAW servants ) ;
( b ) to subject an individual to torture or ill - treatment ( Articles CARDINAL and CARDINAL ) ; and
( c ) to commit unintentional homicide ( Articles CARDINAL and CARDINAL ) , intentional homicide ( Article CARDINAL ) or murder ( Article CARDINAL ) .
Under LAW of LAW , taken in conjunction with Articles CARDINAL and CARDINAL , a prosecution for an offence of ill - treatment or torture by a public official must be brought within DATE .
